title: Hoover® Turbo Scrub Carpet Washer (FH50130): Won’t Pick Up?
description:
Link to this video: http://youtu.be/-4NUVkq30jw

Hi MKJade14! I read your review on Hoover.com about your Turbo Scrub not picking up and put together this quick video with some tips that should help. If you have any more questions, please let us know. 

-

asset.author: Hoover
asset.hookText:
Link to this video: http://youtu.be/-4NUVkq30jw

Hi MKJade14! I read your review on Hoover.com about your Turbo Scrub not picking up and put together this quick video with some tips that should help. If you have any more questions, please let us know. 

-Ian
Hoover Customer Care

transcripts: High end k.j. 14 this is Ian from Hoover. I saw your review on Hoover dot com and I think we can help with your turbo scrubs extracting issues. First make sure your dirty water tank is empty if it's full it will stop picking up and you'll hear a change in pitch like this. You can empty it by removing the tank like so and dumping it out in the sink. Next remove the lid and rinse it along with the filter. Then place the lid back on. Make sure the spores spout cap is placed back in. Next remove your nozzle by lifting up this release latch and pulling it up rinse it under warm water in the sink. Now replace it then place your recovery tank back in make sure it's locked into the base. Lastly check the tool door here and make sure that it's closed. If it's open air will escape and there won't be any suction. Once everything is back together you should notice a significant change in pick up performance. Let us know if you need any more help by a Facebook, Twitter or give us a call at 809 four four nine two zero zero.
